revised_title: Bacon, Harvey, and the Founding Fathers of the Royal Society
tldr: This article discusses the roles of Francis Bacon and William Harvey in the founding of the Royal Society, exploring their contributions to the scientific revolution and the impact of their ideas on the development of modern science. While Bacon is often credited as the driving force behind the Society, the author argues that Harvey's work on circulation and the heart was also crucial to the advancement of scientific knowledge during this time.
